channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Trump's cuts to U.S. foreign aid are imperiling Syria's war crimes investigations
item.description: When former leader Bashar al-Assad fell, new Syria war crimes investigations began. But U.S. budget cuts have halted some work. For families of the di...

item.title: Europe deplores America's 'chlorinated chicken.' How safe is our poultry?
item.description: President Trump wants European countries to start buying U.S. chicken and eggs. But the U.K. and E.U. think American poultry is gross and chemically w...

item.title: Whistleblower says DOGE took sensitive data. And, Harvard rejects Trump's demands
item.description: A whistleblower who works at NLRB says that DOGE may have taken sensitive labor data. And, the Trump administration froze over $2 billion for Harvard ...

item.title: DOGE cut a CDC team as it was about to start a project to help N.C. flood victims
item.description: The National Center for Environmental Health was hollowed out in the cuts of 10,000 federal health workers on April 1. That's the same day an assessme...

item.title: Bipartisan senators rebuke White House move to end legal aid for unaccompanied minors
item.description: The letter obtained by NPR marks a rare bipartisan critique from Capitol Hill of the administration's immigration policy.

item.title: Trump blames Zelensky for starting war after massive Russian attack
item.description: The US president said that you "don't start a war against someone 20 times your size" and hope people give you missiles.

item.title: Officials investigate why Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro’s home was set on fire
Trump freezes $2bn in Harvard funding after university rejects demands
item.description: The White House sent a sweeping list of requirements to the university last week, which it said were aimed at fighting antisemitism.

item.title: Video shows elephants shielding calves during California earthquake
item.description: A video shows the older elephants - Ndlula, Umngani, Khosi - scramble to encircle and shield the two 7-year-old calves Zuli and Mkhaya from any possib...

item.title: Pope puts architect Antoni Gaudí on path to sainthood
item.description: The Spanish architect was a devout Catholic and is best known for Barcelona's Sagrada Familia basilica.

item.title: Gayle King and Blue Origin crew return from space
item.description: "CBS Mornings" Gayle King and the rest of Blue Origin's historic all-women spaceflight crew blasted off on Monday.

item.title: Hamas rejects Israeli ceasefire disarmament proposal - Palestinian official
item.description: The plan also gives no commitment to end the war in return for hostages, a Palestinian official says.

item.title: French prisons hit by wave of overnight attacks
item.description: Vehicles were set on fire in car parks outside several prisons across the country.

item.title: Gayle King describes space launch: "Can't even believe what I saw"
item.description: "CBS Mornings" co-host Gayle King describes the peace and perspective of her roughly 10-minute spaceflight with an all-female Blue Origin crew.

item.title: Share your Never Too Late story with "CBS Mornings"
item.description: "CBS Mornings" is highlighting stories of people conquering new challenges. Share your Never Too Late story!

item.title: Mar 11: CBS News 24/7, 10am ET
item.description: Traders brace for more potential market chaos following Wall Street losses in all U.S. markets; Farmers fear the impact of new Chinese tariffs.

item.title: Trump administration freezes $2.2 billion in grants to Harvard over campus activism
item.description: The federal government says it is freezing more than $2.2 billion in grants and contracts to Harvard University.

item.title: What to know about Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro and the alleged arson at his official residence
